column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=custom.Span|label
#T_RL=custom.Relation|label|BT_custom.Span
#Text=Brawne is best from a fortenight before Mighelmas till Lent.
#Text=Beife and Bakon is good all times,
#Text= the yere.
#Text=Mutton is good at al times,
#Text= but from Easter to midsommer it is
#Text= woorst.
#Text=A fat Pigge is ever in season.
#Text=A gose is worst in midsommer moone,
#Text= and best in stubble time, but when they
#Text= be yonge Greene Geese, than they be
#Text= best.
#Text=Veale is best in January and Fe-
#Text= bruary and all other times good.
#Text=Lambe and young kidde is best be-
#Text= twene Christmast and Lent, and good
#Text= from Easter to whitsontide.
#Text=Kyd is e-
#Text= ver good.
#Text=Hennes be good at all tymes
#Text= but best from November to lent.
#Text=Fat
#Text= Capons be ever in season.
#Text=Pecockes
#Text= be ever good: but when they be young
#Text= and of a good stature, they be as good
#Text=as fesantes, and so be young groncis.
#Text=Sinettes bee best between all Halo-
#Text= wen day and Lent.
#Text=A Mallard is good
#Text= after a frost, till Candelmas, so is a
#Text=
#Text= [2v]
#Text=
#Text= Teale and other wyld foule that swim-
#Text= meth.
#Text=A woodcocke is best from Oc-
#Text= tobre to lent, and so be all others byrdes,
#Text= as Ousels, and Thrushes, Robins, and
#Text= such other, Hearons, Curlewes, Crane,
#Text= Bittoure, Bussarde, be at all tymes
#Text= good, but best in winter, Feasants, Par-
#Text= triche and Raile, be ever good, but best
#Text= when they bee taken with a Hauke.
#Text=Quayle and Larkes be ever in season
#Text= Connyes be ever good, but best from
#Text= Octobre to lent.
#Text=A gelded Deare whe-
#Text= ther hee be fallow or red, is ever in sea-
#Text=son.
#Text=A Pollard is speciall good in Maye
#Text= at midsommer he is a Buck, and very
#Text= good tyll Holy Roode daye before My-
#Text= ghelmas, so likewise in a stagge, but he
#Text= is principall in May.
#Text=A barren Doe is
#Text= best in winter.
#Text=A pricket and a sorell
#Text= sytter is ever in season, chickens be
#Text= ever good and so be pigeons
#Text= if they be yonge.
#Text=Hereafter followeth the order of meats
#Text= how they must be served at the Table
#Text= with their sauces for flesh daies at dinner
#Text=.
#Text=[3r]
#Text=
#Text= The first course.
#Text=Potage or stewed broth.
#Text=Boylde meat or stewed
#Text= meate.
#Text=then make your coffin after this man-
#Text= ner, take a litle fayre water, and halfe
#Text= a fishe of butter, and a litle Saffron,
#Text= and set all this upon a chafindyshe, tyll
#Text= it bee hote, than temper your flower
#Text= with this sayd licour, and the white of
#Text= two egges, & also make your coffin and
#Text= season your Apples with Cinamon,
#Text= Ginger and Sugar inough.
#Text=Then put
#Text= them into your coffin, and bake them.
#Text=To bake Chickins in like paste.
#Text=Take your chickens & season them with
#Text= a litle ginger & salt, and so put them into
#Text= your coffin, & so put in them barberies
#Text= grapes, or goseberies, & halfe a dish of
#Text= buttter, so close them up, & set them in the
#Text= oven, & when they are baken, take the
#Text=
#Text= [9v]
#Text=
#Text= yolkes of vi. egges, and a dishful of ver-
#Text= iuyce, and drawe them through a strai-
#Text= ner, and set them upon a chafingedyshe,
#Text= then draw your baken chikens, and put
#Text= therto this foresayd egges and veriuyce
#Text= and thus serue them hotte.
#Text=To bake pigeons in short paste as you
#Text= make to your baken Apples.
#Text=Season your Pigeons with Pepper,
#Text= Saffron, Cloves and Mace, with ver-
#Text= iuyce and salt, then put them into your
#Text= paste, and so close them up, and bake
#Text= them, they will bake in halfe an houre,
#Text= then take them foorth, and if ye thinke
#Text= them dry, take a litle veriuyce and but-
#Text= ter, and put to them, and so serve them.
#Text=To make Vautes.
#Text=Take the kidney of Veale, and par-
#Text= boyle it till it be tender, then take and
#Text= chop it small with the yolkes of three
#Text= or fouer Egges, than season it with
#Text= dates small cut, small raysins, ginger,
#Text= Suger, Cinnamon, saffron, and a litle
#Text= salt, and for the paste to lay it in, take a
#Text= dosyn of Egges both the white and the
#Text=
#Text= [10r]
#Text=
#Text= yolkes, and beate them well altogether
#Text= then take butter and put into a fryinge
#Text= pan and frye them as thinne as a Pan-
#Text= cake, then lay your stuffe therin, and so
#Text= frye them toghether in a panne, and cast
#Text= suger and ginger upon it, and so serve it
#Text= forth.
#Text=To make Pescoddes.
#Text=Take marrow boones, and pull the
#Text= marrowe oute of them, and cut it in
#Text= two partes, then season it with Suger,
#Text= cinnamon, ginger, and a litle salte, and
#Text= make your paste as fine as ye can, and
#Text= as short and thine as ye can, then frye
#Text= them in swete suet, and cast upon them
#Text= a litle Cinnamon and Ginger, and so
#Text= serve them at the Table.
#Text=To make stockfritures.
#Text=Take the same stuffe that you take to
#Text= a vaut, and that same paste ye take for
#Text= Pescods, and ye may frye them or els
#Text= bake them.
#Text=To stewe Trypes.
#Text=Take a pinte of claret wine, and set
#Text= it upon the fyre and cut your Trypes
#Text=
#Text=[10v]
#Text=
#Text= in small peces, and thereto put in a good
#Text= quantity of Cinnamom and ginger, and
#Text= also a sliced Onion or twaine, and so let
#Text= them boyle halfe an houre, & then serve
#Text= them upon soppes.
#Text=To make a pye of Aloes.
#Text=Take a leg of Mutton, and cut it in
#Text= thin slices, and for stuffinge of the same
#Text= take persely, time, and savery, and chop
#Text= them small, then temper amonge them
#Text= three or foure yolkes of hard egs chopte
#Text= small and small raisins, dates, [cut?]
#Text=with
#Text= mace and a litle salt, then lay all these
#Text= in the stekes, and then rolle them toge-
#Text= ther.
#Text=This done make your pye, and lay
#Text= all these therin, than season them with a
#Text= little suger and cinnamom, saffron, and
#Text=Take beanes and boyle them tender in
#Text= faire water, then take them out and
#Text= breake them in a morter, and strayne
#Text= them with the yolkes of foure egges,
#Text= curde made of milke, then season it up
#Text= with Suger and halfe a dishe of butter,
#Text= and a litle cinnamen, and bake it.
#Text=To make a tarte of Goseberies.
#Text=Take Goseberies and parboyle them
#Text= in white wine, claret or ale, and boyle
#Text= withall a litle white bread, then take
#Text= them up and drawe them throughe a
#Text= strayner as thicke as you can, with the
#Text= yolkes of five Egges, then season it up
#Text= with Suger, halfe a dishe of butter, to
#Text= bake it.
#Text=To bake a Tarte of Medlars.
#Text=Take medlars when they be rotten, &
#Text=
#Text= [11v]
#Text=
#Text= braye them with the yolkes of .iiii.
#Text=Eg-
#Text= ges, then season it up with suger and cin-
#Text= namon and swete butter, and so bake it.
#Text=To make a Tart of Damsons.
#Text=Take Damsons and boyle them in
#Text= wine, eyther red or claret, and put ther-
#Text= to a dosin of peares, or els white bread
#Text= to make them stuffe withall, then draw
#Text= them up with the yolkes of six Egges,
#Text= and sweete butter, and so bake it.
#Text=To make a Tart of Bourage
#Text= Flowers.
#Text=Take Borage flowers and parboile
#Text= them tender, then strayne them with
#Text= the yolkes of three or foure egges and
#Text=sweete curdes, or els take three or fouer
#Text= apples, and parboyle withall, and strain
#Text= them with sweete butter, and a little
#Text= Mace, and so bake it.
#Text=To make a Tart of Marygoldes,
#Text= prim roses, or Couslips.
#Text=Take the same stuffe to every of them
#Text= that you doe to the Tarte of Borage
#Text= and the same seasoning.
#Text=To make a Tart of Strawberies
#Text=.
#Text=[12r]
#Text=
#Text= Take and strain them with the yolkes
#Text= of foure Egges, and a litle white bread
#Text= grated, then season it up with Suger,
#Text= and swete butter, and so bake it.
#Text=six egges, and season it up with Suger
#Text= and sweete butter, and so bake it.
#Text=To make a stewe after the guyse of
#Text=
#Text= [12v]
#Text=
#Text= beyond the Sea.
#Text=Take a pottle of faire water, and as
#Text= much wine, and a brest of mutton chopt
#Text= in pieces, then set it on the fier, and scom
#Text= it cleane, and put thereto a dishe full of
#Text= sliced oynions, and a quantity of Cinna-
#Text= mom, ginger, cloves, and mace, with salt
#Text= and stewe them altogether, and then
#Text= serve them with soppes.
#Text=To make egges in mone shine.
#Text=Take a dishe of rose water, and a dishe
#Text= full of suger, and set them upon a cha-
#Text=fingdish, and let them boile, then take the
#Text= yolkes of 8. or 9. egges newlaid, and put
#Text= them therto, every one from other, and
#Text= so let them harden a little, and so after
#Text= this maner serve them forth, and cast a
#Text= little Cinnamon and suger.
#Text=To make an Appelmoise.
#Text=Take a dosyn apples, and wither roste
#Text= or boyle them, and drawe them tho-
#Text= rowe a Stayner, and the yolkes of
#Text= three or foure egges withall, and as ye
#Text= straine them, temper them with three
#Text= or foure sponefull of damaske water,
#Text=
#Text= [13r]
#Text=
#Text= if ye will, then take and season it with
#Text= suger and halfe a dish of sweete butter, &
#Text= boyle them uopn a chafingdish in a plater, &
#Text=cast biskets or cinnamon and Ginger,
#Text= upon them, and so serve them forth.
#Text=To fry tripes.
#Text=Take your tripes, and cut them in smal
#Text= pieces, and put them into a pan, and put
#Text= therto an oynion or two, and a dishe of
#Text= swete buter, and let them fry till they be
#Text= brown, and then take them out & set them
#Text= upon a chafingdish, and put therto a litle
#Text= veriuyce and ginger, and serve it.
#Text=To make a tart of Prunes.
#Text=Take Prunes and set them up on a cha-
#Text= fer with a litle red wine, and put therto
#Text= a manchet and let them boyle together
#Text= then draw them throw a strainer, with
#Text= the yolkes of .iiii. egges, and season it
#Text= with suger, and so bake it.
#Text=and let it boyle with the Mutton, then
#Text= take twelve Egges, and the sayde two
#Text= ladels full of broth and veriuice, & strain
#Text=
#Text= [14v]
#Text=
#Text= them altogether, then season your broth
#Text= with salt, and a litle before you go to
#Text= diner, put al these to your Mutton, and
#Text= stere it well for quaylynge, and serve it
#Text= foorth with soppes.
#Text=An other broth with long wortes.
#Text=Take mutton and fayre water, and let
#Text= them boile upon the fire, and then take
#Text= lettuce or spinege, and put thereto, and
#Text= if ye list to boyle therewith two or three
#Text= chickens, and put thereto salt & veriuyce
#Text= after your discreation and serve them
#Text= forth, the flesh under, the herbes above.
#Text=or teales, Fesand, patriche, or suche o-
#Text= ther wild foules, and let them boyle allto-
#Text= gether, then season them with Salte,
#Text= and serve them forth.
#Text=To make Porraie.
#Text=Take a capon or a hen, and either bief
#Text= ir Mutton to make the brothe sweete
#Text= withall, and boyle them all together till
#Text= they be very tender, then take the capon
#Text= or Hen out of the pot & take out all his
#Text= bones, and bray him in a morter, with
#Text= ii. pounde of Almondes over blaunched,
#Text= then with the brothe of your Capon or
#Text= Hen straine them metely thick, then put
#Text= it in a little potte, and season it with a
#Text= little Suger, Sanders, Cloves, Mace,
#Text= and small raisins, so boile him and serve
#Text= him upon soppes.
#Text=To stew bones or gristles of Biefe.
#Text=Take gristles of biefe, and stew them
#Text= as tender as ye can, sixe houres so that
#Text= there be no broth lefte that shall serve
#Text=
#Text= [15v]
#Text=
#Text= you as that tyme, than put a good bun-
#Text= del of rosemary in a fayrelinnen cloth
#Text= and a good quantitye of Mace in another
#Text= cloth, and boyle them altogether, then
#Text= wringe out the iuyce of the Rosemary
#Text= and mace, upon the flesh and season it
#Text= with salt, and so serve [him?].
#Text=For to stewe Mutton.
#Text=Take a necke of Mutton and a brest to
#Text= make the broth Stronge, and then scum
#Text= it cleane, and when it hath boyled a
#Text= while, take part of the broth, and put it
